alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued January 01 at 7:36PM PST until January 04 at 9:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents and elevated surf of 4 to 7 feet. Local sets to 10 feet possible near Point Conception. * WHERE...Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast and Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats nearshore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Minimal coastal flooding risk through Thursday. Another round of high surf will be likely this weekend.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast
